name: Shanghai's Best
dishnotes1: Really great authentic street-food-style dumplings. Pan-fried is the way to go here, but I'm sure the steamed ones are good too. Don't forget to add chili oil!
dishnotes2: The vegetarian option here is really good, but they contain egg. The pan fried are the way to go here, but I'm sure the steamed ones are good too. Don't forget to add chili oil!

name: La Jarocita
dishname1: Carnitas huarache with everything, black beans
dishnotes1: You can't go wrong here, try anything!
dishnotes2: A great cart that offers tofu! Not a very common thing for mexican food, so if you are a veggie burrito lover, this one is worth trying. You can ask for no dairy, and also add potatoes if you wish. They are super nice!

name: Huong's
dishnotes1: Possibly the best-value food deal in PDX. $4 for a full meal. They will offer to have the peanuts in the sandwich (recommended) or on the side.
dishnotes2: Hands down best value for a really great sandwich. 4$ for a full meal. This is the vegetarian alternative to the meat options, but I haven't been able to confirm if it's totally vegan. The (amazingly delicious) sauce they put on it might contain fish sauce.

name: Rolling Gourmet Fusion
dishnotes1: Seriously, any of them. And any 2 side items. Depending on which rolls you order, this can be a gluten free meal.

name: 808 Grinds
dishnotes1: Or anything, their menu is simple. Even the mac salad is good. Try the different sauces.

name: Gyro Place
dishnotes1: Or the kafta gyro if you're not starving (the rice plates are huge and come with salad and hummus) - or the unique falafel.
dishnotes2: This comes with a salad, hummus, rice, falafel, tzaziki, sauces, and pita upon request. Very good food, and super nice folks.

name: Nong's Kao Man Gai
dishnotes1: Delicious pressure-cooked chicken and rice. Comes with a bowl of ginger sauce and a bowl of soup. Order it spicy if you dare! Also: great Thai iced-tea & iced-coffee.

name: Noodle House
dishnotes1: Very high quality handmade everything.
dishnotes2: I have not confirmed if the noodles are vegan, but this is a great vegetarian option at a solid cart. Get it spicy.

name: E-San
dishnotes1: I think this is the best Pad Thai deal around, these folks know what they're doing (there will likely be a line for this cart). Any of the menu items can be made vegetarian, and also vegan (with no egg or fish sauce). Having tried it all 3 ways, I can say it has been consistently good.
dishnotes2: This is a really tasty stir fry, something a little different that took me a while to try - and now its my favorite! Can be made vegetarian or vegan upon request, also ask for brown rice if you prefer.

name: Grilled Cheese Grill
dishnotes1: Safe comfort food here. Can be made with vegan substitutions!

name: Tito's Burritos
dishnotes1: One of my favorite places to get a chicken burrito. They really do a So-Cal style burrito justice here in Portland where that can be hard to find. Salsas are recommended.
dishnotes2: Solid veggie burrito, can be made vegan upon request. The red and green sauce here are great.

name: Wolf and Bear's
dishnotes1: Portland-style Mediterranean food. This wrap has really great fresh veggies (fried egg plant too!), crispy falafel, and some an amazing tahini sauce with hummus.
dishnotes2: Really tasty salad that will satisfy your hunger. I usually add a couple falafel.

name: The Whole Bowl
dishnotes1: This is the only thing they serve, in 2 sizes. One of Portland's most popular food carts, with a bunch of locations all over town. The sauce is reknowned and makes a simple dish something special. Can be requested vegan, they will give you extra avocado.

name: Burger Stevens
dishnotes1: High quality standard burgers and fries. This cart offers a full list of add-ons (avocado, egg, bacon, etc.). The double with fries is a LOT of food, but very good.
dishnotes2: High quality standard burgers and fries. Everything at this cart is good. The veggie burger can be made vegan with avocado spread. Fries are $3 extra but so worth it.

name: Fried Egg I'm In Love
dishnotes1: Their signature dish, can be made vegatarian with veggie sausage.

name: Stretch the Noodle
dishnotes1: This place is pretty special. The noodles are hand made - right in front of you! Pretty cool to see, but it does take a little bit. Try to avoid lunch rush. Tofu and veggies option is great, but they have meat versions as well as other dishes that look great.

name: Greenleaf
dishnotes1: You can ask for gluten free oatmeal for an extra few bucks. located off pioneer square. absolutely two meals for the price of one.

name: Tasty n Alder
dishnotes1: Literally anything you get will be good. This place can get full for lunch, but it's great for a more upscale sit-down lunch.

name: La Jarocha
dishnotes1: A little bit of a walk, but worth it for a good sit down lunch. The menu doesn't seem to be very vegetarian-friendly but it might be worth calling about.

name: Bamboo Sushi
dishnotes1: A bit expensive, but is known as one of the best places to get sushi in town. This dish can be served without albacore, making it vegan, and it is also very good.

name: Shigezo
dishnotes1: The menu here is vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free friendly, just talk to your server. Known for the Ramen, but everything else is good. This is an excellent place for sushi.

name: Habibi
dishnotes1: Great place for a sit-down group lunch, and the menu is very diverse with every section split into vegan, vegetarian and meat. It's a short walk and they usually have a table. Gluten-free folks talk to your server, but for the most part just avoid the bread.

name: Mayas Taqueria
dishnotes1: Easy place to walk in and order. solid food, burritos come with chips and salsa. Can be requested vegan, and the habenero salsa is excellent.

name: Southpark
dishnotes1: A sit-down that is very close, and serves quality food. They are known for their clam chowder, but I hear pretty much everything else is good too!
dishnotes2: A go-to dish, really delicious. Basically tied with the clam chowder in quality.

name: Darsalam
dishnotes1: Really good buffet style lunch, affordable, and pretty close.

name: Addys Sandwich Bar
dishnotes1: This sandwich is amazing. I recommend the baguette version, but you can order in various sandwich forms. They have a nice little deli selection of salads and things to choose from.
dishnotes2: I love this place. I recommend the baguette version, but you can order in various sandwich forms. They have a nice little deli selection of salads and things to choose from.

name: Thai Peacock
dishnotes1: Really great sit down lunch spot, with a full menu. Gets a little busy in there, but it is highly recommended for pretty much any dish. One of the best Thai places in town.
